DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Primary Neoplasm Resistance Process Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient is resistant to platinum therapy due to prior treatment with platinum-based chemotherapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Primary Neoplasm Resistance Process Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the platinum resistance due to prior administration of platinum-based chemotherapy to treat the primary cancer as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Primary Neoplasm Resistance Process Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):The original tumor.:A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
A tumor at the original site of origin.

A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient resistant to plati
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient resistant to platinum therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has ovarian cancer, is patient resistant to platinum therapy (i.e. within 6 months of last platinum therapy) and has received less than or equal to two prior platinum containing regimens?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have platinum resistant disease defined as progression within 6 months of last platinum regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has ovarian, fallopian tube or primary peritoneal cancer does patient have platinum resistant disease defined as progression within 6 months after last platinum regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient female with epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal carcinoma that is platinum-resistant disease *defined as having relapsed within 6 months of last platinum-containing regimen)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient female with epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal carcinoma that is platinum-resistant disease (defined as having relapsed within 6 months of last platinum-containing regimen)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have platinum resistant disease or platinum sensitive disease that is past the first or second recurrence?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed recurrent platinum-resistant EOC of any histology, as defined by progression within 6 months of the last dose of platinum-based chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Dose Expansion Cohort, does patient have platinum resistant ovarian cancer that is defined as progression within 6 months after the last platinum regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose expansion exploratory cohorts (nivolumab + ipilimumab + ZEN003694):  Does patient have recurrent BRCAwt epithelial ovarian carcinoma and has progressed or recurred within less than 6 months from prior platinum-based therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has ovarian cancer, does patient have platinum-resistant disease (progression within 6 months of last receipt of platinum)?
